definitions.definition: A semi-translucent, moisture-proof paper made with a waxy coating, used primarily for wrapping and packaging.
Any of the coronary vessels; a coronary artery or coronary vein.
A small bone in the foot of a horse.
Pertaining to a crown or garland.
Encircling something (like a crown), especially with regard to the arteries or veins of the heart.
Thrombosis of a coronary artery, that is, a blockage, caused by a blood clot, of the blood flow in a coronary artery of the heart, leading to myocardial infarction.
A substance which causes an allergic reaction.
definitions.example: Pollen, dust, and spores are common allergens.

definitions.definition: Any of several animals related to Equus ferus caballus.
Equipment with legs.
Type of equipment.

A mass of earthy matter, or rock of the same character as the wall rock, occurring in the course of a vein, as of coal or ore; hence, to take horse (said of a vein) is to divide into branches for a distance.
The sedative, antidepressant, and anxiolytic drug morphine, chiefly when used illicitly.

An informal variant of basketball in which players match shots made by their opponent(s), each miss adding a letter to the word "horse", with 5 misses spelling the whole word and eliminating a player, until only the winner is left. Also HORSE, H-O-R-S-E or H.O.R.S.E. (see Variations of basketball#H-O-R-S-E).
(among students) A translation or other illegitimate aid in study or examination.
(among students) horseplay; tomfoolery
Heroin (drug).
definitions.example: Alright, mate, got any horse?

definitions.definition: An ugly old woman, a hag.
(chiefly of horses) A gait of a four-legged animal between walk and canter, a diagonal gait (in which diagonally opposite pairs of legs move together).
A gait of a person or animal faster than a walk but slower than a run.
A brisk journey or progression.
definitions.example: In this lesson we'll have a quick trot through Chapter 3 before moving on to Chapter 4.

definitions.definition: A toddler.
A young animal.
A moderately rapid dance.
A succession of heads thrown in a game of two-up.
(with "good" or "bad") A run of luck or fortune.
definitions.example: He′s had a good trot, but his luck will end soon.

definitions.definition: (as 'the trots') Diarrhoea.
definitions.example: He's got a bad case of the trots and has to keep running off to the toilet.

definitions.definition: To move along briskly; specifically, to move at a pace between a walk and a run.
definitions.example: I didn't want to miss my bus, so I trotted the last few hundred yards to the stop.

definitions.definition: (of a horse) To move at a gait between a walk and a canter.
To cause to move, as a horse or other animal, in the pace called a trot; to cause to run without galloping or cantering.
A genre of Korean pop music employing repetitive rhythm and vocal inflections.
A supporter of Trotskyism.
Marked by heated arguments or controversy.
Given to struggling with others out of jealousy or discord.
A dull, fairly quick explosive or percussive sound, as if made by a labouring engine.
A large gulp of drink.
definitions.example: He drank his beer in three chugs.

definitions.definition: A homemade Cuban boat, built to carry emigrants to the USA, and often abandoned upon arrival.
To make dull explosive sounds.
To move or travel whilst making such sounds.
definitions.example: We were chugging along a back road when the engine cut out.

definitions.definition: To drink a large amount (especially of beer) in a single action/without breathing; to chugalug. People usually chant this at the person who is drinking.
definitions.example: Chug! Chug! Chug!

definitions.definition: A dog; a cross between a pug and a chihuahua.
To solicit charitable donations on the street, particularly in a persistent manner.
definitions.example: I got chugged in the town centre today.

definitions.definition: (racial slur) A person of Native American descent.
A type of semi-hard to hard cheese originating in Netherlands.
Evading capture, comprehension or remembrance.
definitions.example: The elusive criminal was arrested

definitions.definition: Difficult to make precise.
definitions.example: A precise definition of diarrhea is elusive (Robbin's pathology, 8th ed)

definitions.definition: Rarely seen.
Of, facing, situated in, or related to the south-west
(of a wind) blowing from the south-west; south-westerly
To remove a cover from.
definitions.example: The model railway was uncovered.

definitions.definition: To reveal the identity of.
definitions.example: The murderer has finally been uncovered.

definitions.definition: To show openly; to disclose; to reveal.
To remove one's hat or cap as a mark of respect.
To expose the genitalia.
To expose (lines of formation of troops) successively by the wheeling to right or left of the lines in front.
An automobile designed for high speed and power, tight handling, and flashy looks.
Any substance that acts to slow or prevent the oxidation of another chemical.
(nutrition) One of a group of vitamins that act against the effects of free radicals.
Acting or having agents that act against oxidation.
Evoking a feeling of hatred.
Dislikeable.
Full of hatred.
To be on fire, especially producing bright flames.
definitions.example: The campfire blazed merrily.

definitions.definition: To send forth or reflect a bright light; shine like a flame.
To be conspicuous; shine brightly a brilliancy (of talents, deeds, etc.).
To set in a blaze; burn.
To cause to shine forth; exhibit vividly; be resplendent with.
(only in the past participle) To mark with a white spot on the face (as a horse).
To set a mark on (as a tree, usually by cutting off a piece of its bark).
To indicate or mark out (a trail, especially through vegetation) by a series of blazes.
definitions.example: The guide blazed his way through the undergrowth.

definitions.definition: To set a precedent for the taking-on of a challenge; lead by example.
definitions.example: Darwin blazed a path for the rest of us.

definitions.definition: To be furiously angry; to speak or write in a rage.
To smoke marijuana.
To blow, as from a trumpet
To publish; announce publicly
To disclose; bewray; defame
To blazon
The act of something that blazes or burns.
definitions.example: the blazings of many fires

definitions.definition: Very fast.
(of a person) Sexually attractive.
definitions.example: The actress, with her perfectly-curved body, was simply blazing in her new movie!

definitions.definition: Of tremendous intensity or fervor; white-hot.
definitions.example: It was a performance of blazing ferocity.

definitions.definition: Exceedingly angry.
definitions.example: The divorced couple had a blazing row.

definitions.definition: A circular rotating platform.
To play (a record) using a turntable.
To rotate or turn around using, or as if using, a turntable.
To manipulate sound using turntables; to perform turntablism.
To run quickly or for a short distance.
definitions.example: He dashed across the field.

definitions.definition: To leave or depart.
definitions.example: I have to dash now. See you soon.

definitions.definition: To destroy by striking (against).
definitions.example: He dashed the bottle against the bar and turned about to fight.

definitions.definition: To throw violently.
definitions.example: The man was dashed from the vehicle during the accident.

definitions.definition: (sometimes figurative) To sprinkle; to splatter.
To mix, reduce, or adulterate, by throwing in something of an inferior quality.
definitions.example: to dash wine with water

definitions.definition: (of hopes or dreams) To ruin; to destroy.
definitions.example: Her hopes were dashed when she saw the damage.

definitions.definition: To dishearten; to sadden.
To complete hastily, usually with down or off.
definitions.example: He dashed down his eggs, she dashed off her homework

definitions.definition: To draw quickly; jot.
The action of the verb to dash.
Spirited, audacious and full of high spirits.
Chic, fashionable.
definitions.example: All heads turned as the dashing young man entered the room.

definitions.definition: The quality or state of being vivacious.
A parallelogram which is neither a rhombus nor a rectangle
Any of several muscles that control the shoulders
A solid shape which has rhombic faces
Resembling, or shaped like a rhombus or rhomboid
One who enforces confinement in a jail or prison.
To make dizzy or unsteady.
To reel; to whirl.
Dizzy, feeling dizzy or unsteady and as if about to fall down.
definitions.example: The man became giddy upon standing up so fast.

definitions.definition: Causing dizziness: causing dizziness or a feeling of unsteadiness.
definitions.example: They climbed to a giddy height.

definitions.definition: Lightheartedly silly, or joyfully elated.
definitions.example: The boy was giddy when he opened his birthday presents.

definitions.definition: Frivolous, impulsive, inconsistent, changeable.
To perform the sacrament of baptism by sprinkling or pouring water over someone or immersing them in water.
To dedicate or christen.
Of rum, brandy, or any other spirits, to dilute with water.
To ensure proper burning of a joint by moistening the exterior with saliva.
A coming to; the act of acceding and becoming joined
definitions.example: a king's accession to a confederacy

definitions.definition: Increase by something added; that which is added; augmentation from without.

A mode of acquiring property, by which the owner of a corporeal substance which receives an addition by growth, or by labor, has a right to the part or thing added, or the improvement (provided the thing is not changed into a different species).
The act by which one power becomes party to engagements already in force between other powers.
The act of coming to or reaching a throne, an office, or dignity.
The invasion, approach, or commencement of a disease; a fit or paroxysm.
Agreement.
Access; admittance.
To make a record of (additions to a collection).
Nervous; worried.
definitions.example: She was all keyed up about the interview.

definitions.definition: An application that searches for, and retrieves, data based on some criteria, especially one that searches the Internet for documents containing specified words.
A person who plays the piano, particularly with skill or as part of an orchestra.
(WWII) A spy using radio or wireless telegraphy to keep in touch with headquarters during the Second World War
Pertaining to one's bodily constitution; physically, physiologically.
In accordance with a political constitution.
A piece of freestanding stage scenery
Any carefully planned sequence of operations, especially as part of a military operation
An elaborate and interesting scene in a movie or video game, usually the most important and visually iconic scene in the work.
Any planned strategy that a team uses after play is restarted with a free kick, penalty kick, corner kick, goal kick, throw-in or kickoff.
definitions.example: Roberto Carlos is deadly from set pieces.

definitions.definition: A small commercial brewery, often one serving a single pub at which it is physically located; in the United States, often used to indicate a brewery that produces fewer than 15,000 barrels of beer annually.
A short school holiday in the middle of the term.
Pertaining to the half term school holiday.
The release of a former prisoner under condition of compliance with specific terms.
definitions.example: He was released on parole.

definitions.definition: The amount of time a former prisoner spends on limited release.
A word of honor, especially given by a prisoner of war, to not engage in combat if released.
Language in use, as opposed to language as a system.
(immigration law) The permission for a foreigner who does not meet the technical requirements for a visa to be allowed to enter the U.S. on humanitarian grounds.
A watchword given only to officers of guards; distinguished from the countersign, which is given to all guards.
An oral declaration; see parol.
To release (a prisoner) on the understanding that s/he checks in regularly and obeys the law.
A skilled politician or one with political power, knowledge or influence.
A statistician.
A supporter of statism.
Pertaining to statism.
The bottom of a face, (specifically) the typically jutting jawline below the mouth.
Talk.
A lie, a falsehood.
The ability to withstand being punched in the chin without being knocked out.
The lower part of the front of an aircraft, below the nose.
The bottom part of a mobile phone, below the screen.
To talk.
To talk to or with (someone).
To perform a chin-up (exercise in which one lifts one's own weight while hanging from a bar).
To punch or hit (someone)'s chin (part of the body).
To put or hold (a musical instrument) up to one's chin.
To turn on or operate (a device) using one's chin; to select (a particular setting) using one's chin.
To put one's chin on (something).
To indicate or point toward (someone or something) with one's chin.
A chinchilla.
A draft directing a bank to pay money to a named person or entity.
definitions.example: I was not carrying cash, so I wrote a cheque for the amount.

definitions.definition: Any of the many games played with playing cards.
To fill with horror; to dismay.
definitions.example: The evidence put forth at the court appalled most of the jury.

definitions.definition: To make pale; to blanch.
To weaken; to reduce in strength
To grow faint; to become weak; to become dismayed or discouraged.
To lose flavour or become stale.
Shocked, horrified by something unpleasant.
Work carried out by students of a particular course; it is assessed and counts towards the grade given.
A single order to allow a commercial, or similar entity to charge directly to one's bank for a regular payment.
A female member of congress
A female member of the House of Representatives
Glamour.
A style of rock music, glam rock, associated with an androgynous yet masculine look and a driving, pounding bluesy form of psychedelic rock; the fashion and culture associated with this genre.
To make glamorous or more glamorous.
Glamorous.
A freshwater fish, tropical cichlids of the genus Pterophyllum.
A marine fish of the family Pomacanthidae, common on shallow tropical reefs.
The amount necessary to make a cup full
definitions.example: Add a cupful of milk to the sauce.

definitions.definition: A half pint, i.e. eight ounces
A board on which electronic components and their interconnecting circuits are mounted or etched
A gateway to the inner part of an Ancient Egyptian temple.
A tower-like structure, usually one of a series, used to support high-voltage electricity cables.
A structure used to mount engines, missiles etc., to the underside of an aircraft wing or fuselage.
A starting derrick for an aeroplane.
A post, tower, etc. as on an aerodrome, or flying ground, serving to bound or mark a prescribed course of flight.
An obelisk.
A traffic cone.
An orange marker designating one of the four corners of the end zone in American football.
A rigid prosthesis for the lower leg.
To talk to someone in order to dissuade them from doing something.
definitions.example: My brother wanted a pet squirrel, but I talked him out of it.

definitions.definition: To cause (something) to become damaged, useless, or ineffective through continued use, especially hard, heavy, or careless use.
definitions.example: He wears a pair of tennis shoes out every summer.

definitions.definition: To deteriorate or become unusable or ineffective due to continued use, exposure, or strain.
definitions.example: My shoes wear out quickly now that I walk to work.

definitions.definition: To exhaust; to cause or contribute to another's exhaustion, fatigue, or weariness, as by continued strain or exertion.
definitions.example: Our physical advantage allowed us to wear the other team out and win.

definitions.definition: To become exhausted, tired, fatigued, or weary, as by continued strain or exertion.
definitions.example: I'm wearing out, guys. Time to go to sleep.

definitions.definition: Of apparel, to display in public.
definitions.example: Those sweatpants are great for loafing around the house, but they're not meant to be worn out.

definitions.definition: Of a shirt, to not tuck into the pants; to wear in a casual manner.
definitions.example: A dress shirt should be tucked in, but a t-shirt can be worn out.

definitions.definition: To punish by spanking.
Damaged and useless due to hard or continued use.
definitions.example: That old tractor is worn out.

definitions.definition: Exhausted or fatigued from exertion.
definitions.example: I was worn out after all that work.

definitions.definition: Either of two small gulls in the genus Rissa of the family Laridae that nest in colonies on sea cliffs and spend the winter on the open ocean.
A sudden, usually noisy expulsion of air from the lungs, often involuntary.
definitions.example: Behind me, I heard a distinct, dry cough.

definitions.definition: A condition that causes one to cough; a tendency to cough.
definitions.example: Sorry, I can't come to work today – I've got a nasty cough.

definitions.definition: Used to focus attention on a following utterance, often a euphemism or an attribution of blame
definitions.example: He was – cough – indisposed.

definitions.definition: To push air from the lungs in a quick, noisy explosion.
definitions.example: I breathed in a lungful of smoke by mistake, and started to cough.

definitions.definition: (sometimes followed by "up") To force something out of the throat or lungs by coughing.
definitions.example: Sometimes she coughed (up) blood.

definitions.definition: To make a noise like a cough.
definitions.example: The engine coughed and sputtered.

definitions.definition: Any plant of the genus Helianthus, so called probably from the form and color of its floral head, having the form of a large disk surrounded by yellow ray flowers.
A bright yellow, like that of the flower petals.
Any flat, radially symmetric organic compound such as coronene
A long-legged, long-necked wading bird of the family Ardeidae.
A vehicle supported on a cushion of air, able to traverse many different types of terrain and travel over water, used for transport.
To disconnect or detach one thing from another.
definitions.example: We uncoupled the trailer and left it behind.

definitions.definition: To come loose.
To loose, as dogs, from their couples.
Not situated on a street; e.g. off-street parking, in contrast to parking on a street.
To raise from the dead, to bring life back to.
To restore to a working state.
To bring back to view or attention; reinstate.

A person whose occupation is to transcribe spoken or recorded speech into written form, typically using a stenotype or stenomask to produce official transcripts of court hearings, depositions and other official proceedings.
Idle talk; senseless prattle
Inarticulate speech; constant or confused murmur.
A sound like that of water gently flowing around obstructions.
To utter words indistinctly or unintelligibly; to utter inarticulate sounds
definitions.example: The men were babbling, so we couldn't make sense of anything.

definitions.definition: To talk incoherently; to utter meaningless words.
To talk too much; to chatter; to prattle.
To make a continuous murmuring noise, like shallow water running over stones.
definitions.example: Hounds are said to babble, or to be babbling, when they are too noisy after having found a good scent.

definitions.definition: To utter in an indistinct or incoherent way; to repeat words or sounds in a childish way without understanding.
To reveal; to give away (a secret).
Any of various spiny cacti of the genus Opuntia.
The fruit, often edible, of such a plant.
Any apparatus used to maintain environmental conditions suitable for a reaction.
An apparatus used to maintain environmental conditions suitable for a newborn baby.
An apparatus used to maintain environmental conditions suitable for the hatching of eggs.
A place to maintain the culturing of bacteria at a steady temperature.
A support programme for the development of entrepreneurial companies.
A person who espouses left-wing political views.
A member of the left wing of a party or group.
A person who plays the position of left wing.
The number of dead as a result of a war, natural disaster or other incident.
To make (a person) angry, distressed, or unhappy.
definitions.example: I’m sure the bad news will upset him, but he needs to know.

definitions.definition: To disturb, disrupt or adversely alter (something).
definitions.example: Introducing a foreign species can upset the ecological balance.

definitions.definition: To tip or overturn (something).
To defeat unexpectedly.
definitions.example: Truman upset Dewey in the 1948 US presidential election.

definitions.definition: To be upset or knocked over.
definitions.example: The carriage upset when the horse bolted.

definitions.definition: To set up; to put upright.
To thicken and shorten, as a heated piece of iron, by hammering on the end.
To shorten (a tire) in the process of resetting, originally by cutting it and hammering on the ends.
The action of the verb upset.
Causing upset; distressing.
definitions.example: He found taking his cat to the vet to be put down very upsetting.

definitions.definition: Conceited; presumptuous.
A diving board consisting of a flexible, springy, cantilevered platform, used for diving into water.
A small platform on springs and usually hinged at one end, used to launch or vault onto other equipment.
Anything that gives a person or thing energy or impulse, or that serves to launch or begin something.
definitions.example: The opportunity served a springboard to their success.

definitions.definition: To launch or propel as if from a springboard, especially toward political office.
Grandfather
A familiar or disparaging term of address to an old man.
definitions.example: Hey! Get out of my way, granddad!

definitions.definition: Boisterous, energetic, noisy, and difficult to control.
definitions.example: The kids are being especially rambunctious today.

definitions.definition: The property of a word of sounding like what it represents.
A word that sounds like what it represents, such as "gurgle" or "hiss".
The use of language whose sound imitates that which it names.
A long, curved, wooden horn used by mountain-dwelling herders in the Alps, originally to call cattle but now only as musical instrument in classical and folk tunes.
An airport building from which the air traffic control unit monitors and directs the movement of aircraft on and around the airport.
An enclosed, raised structure occupied by one or more persons who operate or exercise control over railway traffic, ship movement, a racetrack, machinery, etc.
To violate; to breach; to break.
definitions.example: This sentence goes against English grammar.

definitions.definition: To be unfavourable to someone.
definitions.example: The court's decision went against them.

definitions.definition: To be contrary to a trend, feeling or principle.
definitions.example: This goes against my instincts.

definitions.definition: To oppose; to resist
definitions.example: He dared not go against the King.

definitions.definition: The act of persecuting.
A program or campaign to subjugate or eliminate a specific group of people, often based on race, religion, sexuality, or social beliefs.
Of or pertaining to fatalism.
Submissive to fate.
A vase with a footed base.
A metal vessel for serving tea or coffee.
A vessel for the ashes or cremains of a deceased person.
Any place of burial; the grave.
A measure of capacity for liquids, containing about three gallons and a half, wine measure. It was half the amphora, and four times the congius.
A hollow body shaped like an urn, in which the spores of mosses are contained; a spore case; a theca.
To place in an urn.
Of, pertaining to or derived using probability.
Of or pertaining to the Roman Catholic doctrine of probabilism.
One who goes sightseeing; one who goes around to look at sights or see things of interest; a tourist.
An adult male deer.
A colt, or filly.
(by extension) A romping girl; a tomboy.
An improperly or late castrated bull or ram – also called a bull seg (see note under ox).
An outside irregular dealer in stocks, who is not a member of the exchange.
One who applies for the allotment of shares in new projects, with a view to sell immediately at a premium, and not to hold the stock.
The Eurasian wren, Troglodytes troglodytes.
(usually attributive) An unmarried male, a bachelor; a male not accompanying a female at a social event.
definitions.example: a stag dance; a stag party

definitions.definition: A social event for males held in honor of a groom on the eve of his wedding, attended by male friends of the groom, sometimes a fund-raiser.
definitions.example: The stag will be held in the hotel's ballroom.

definitions.definition: A stag beetle (family Lucanidae).
Guard duty.
To act as a "stag", an irregular dealer in stocks.
To watch; to dog, or keep track of.
Of a man, attending a formal social function without a date.
A short radio or television broadcast made by a political party
Not having a high number of calories from fat or great amount of fats. Especially an alternate variety of food designed to have lower calories, dietetic.
The sound of metal or glass clattering against itself.
definitions.example: He heard the jingle of her keys in the door and turned off the screen.

definitions.definition: A small piece of metal attached to a musical instrument, such as a tambourine, so as to make a jangling sound when the instrument is played.
definitions.example: Her tambourine didn't come with any jingles attached.

definitions.definition: A memorable short song, or in some cases a snippet of a popular song with its lyrics modified, used for the purposes of advertising a product or service in a TV or radio commercial.
definitions.example: That used-car dealership's jingle has been stuck in my head since we heard that song.

definitions.definition: A carriage drawn by horses.
A brief phone call; a ring.
definitions.example: Give me a jingle when you find out something.

definitions.definition: A jingle shell.
Coin money.
To make a noise of metal or glass clattering against itself.
definitions.example: The beads jingled as she walked.

definitions.definition: To cause to make a noise of metal or glass clattering against itself.
definitions.example: She jingled the beads as she walked.

definitions.definition: To rhyme or sound with a jingling effect.

A mental disorder, less severe than psychosis, marked by anxiety or fear which differ from normal measures by their intensity, which disorder results from a failure to compromise or properly adjust during the developmental stages of life, between normal human instinctual impulses and the demands of human society.
The state of being married.
A wife; a married woman.
